head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Ronkonkoma: Turkey Thrown Through Windshield Injures Woman

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Ronkonkoma: Turkey Thrown Through Windshield Injures Woman

body.head.byline: By Patrick Healy (NYT); Compiled by George James

abstract.p: Suffolk County police say woman driving through Lake Ronkonkoma was critically injured by turkey that was hurled through her car's windshield; are looking for several teenagers who used stolen credit card to buy turkey at nearby supermarket (S)

block.p: A 44-year-old woman driving through Lake Ronkonkoma early Saturday morning was critically injured by a 20-pound turkey that was hurled through her car's windshield, the Suffolk County Police said yesterday. The woman was driving west on Portion Road when someone in an oncoming car threw the turkey. A passenger in her car was able to steer it to the side of the road. The woman, whose name was not released, was taken to Stony Brook University Hospital, where she was in critical condition last night. The police said several teenagers used a stolen credit card to buy the turkey at a nearby supermarket earlier that evening. They are being sought.
